thread.title: Bodyline to Botham – a unique rivalry
thread.title_full: Bodyline to Botham – a unique rivalry - Telegraph

author: Oliver Pickup
title: Bodyline to Botham – a unique rivalry
text: The intense sporting rivalry between England and Australia has been going strong for the best part of 140 years. Here are some of the many highlights: 1932-33 Cricket The “Bodyline” Ashes series in Australia is arguably the most controversial clash in the history of the rivalry. England win the series but Australians still seethe about the provocative bowling. 1981 Cricket Ian Botham’s swashbuckling century and Bob Willis’s eight-wicket haul on the final morning turn the Headingley Test and a memorable Ashes series on its head. 1989 Rugby union Jeremy Guscott stars as the Lions triumph in Australia. 2003 Football Wayne Rooney’s England debut ends in an shock 3-1 defeat by the Socceroos at Upton Park. 2003 Rugby union Jonny Wilkinson kicks a last-minute drop goal to beat Australia in Sydney and put England on top of the world. 2005 Cricket Michael Vaughan’s side win the Ashes to claim the famous old urn after 18 years. 2015 Tennis Andy Murray powers Great Britain to their first Davis Cup final since 1978 with a semi-final win over Australia. Competition can be healthy Vitality is a big believer in harnessing friendly rivalry to promote the power of sport and physical activity. So it has established a considerable and growing presence in top-class UK sport, with high-profile partnerships in rugby, football, cricket and netball to name a few. Since the upsurge in grassroots sport after London 2012, it has been active in encouraging many community-based initiatives. The Vitality Run Series has attracted more than 100,000 participants in two years. Almost 1,000 children and their families attended the first Vitality SportFest, giving kids a chance to get hands-on coaching from top sports stars. Long may it last. • For more information on health and lifestyle, visit vitality.com
